intro: Halimium ocymoides var. algarvense, commonly known as the Algarve hemicarpha, is a flowering plant native to southern Portugal. It is a low-growing perennial that produces clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers in late spring. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is often found in rocky soils and coastal areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Caryophyllaceae family.
